posts.post_content:
This one is blatantly overpriced.  
I have no idea why anyone should want to play this even if he wasn't legendary:  
Four mana (double-red) for a tiny 1/1 that can only deal damage to attacking creatures (*not even at least blocking ones, as apposed to most white creautres' "combat shooter" effect*) equal to the number of *untapped* mountains you control?  
Please, come on...
posts.html:

I have no idea why anyone should want to play this even if he wasn't legendary:
Four mana (double-red) for a tiny 1/1 that can only deal damage to attacking creatures (not even at least blocking ones, as apposed to most white creautres' "combat shooter" effect) equal to the number of untapped mountains you control?
Please, come on...

posts.post_content:
I think his ability is playable. But like someone else said, Kamigawa was just a bad block. They didn't factor in Power and Toughness when pricing cards. This guy would have been decent as a 0 / 3 or something, since his ability suggests he's very defensive.  
  
Ah well. :\

posts.post_content: Nah. He costs too much to play and is very low P/T. And his ability is only *attacking creatures* and *untapped mountains*. So you have to hold back that many mountains to stop a creature from attacking. If it were *target creature* or just plain *mountains*, he would be a beast, but hes just too restricted.
